events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident that occurred on March 30th involving a rear-end collision on a busy street.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing preliminary details provided by the insured.
An agent was assigned promptly to the case to ensure quick follow-up and communication with the policyholder.
The claim has been officially acknowledged, and the customer was informed about the next steps in the process.
Request sent for a police report, vehicle damage photographs, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The insured submitted all requested documents, including police report and detailed repair cost estimates.
Investigation began to verify the circumstances around the collision and assess liability and damages.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured was not at fault in the vehicle accident.
A settlement proposal was sent to the policyholder covering the repair costs minus the deductible.
The policyholder responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the timely settlement offer.
The claim was officially approved following customer agreement to the proposed settlement terms.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued directly to the insuredâ€™s bank account.
The claim file was closed after successful payment and confirmation that all procedures are complete.
